page.title: 08Well Dressings
page.content: In Carnival Week in July each year, the{Well Dressings} are held in Bakewell. The dressings take about a week to make and consist of petals, leaves, seeds and gravel pressed into clay to form a picture. The pictures that decorate the wells sometimes show a part of Bakewell or a village nearby, or more often have a religious theme. Once in position, the Blessing of the Wells takes place, when the Vicar goes to each well in turn and performs a blessing. This ceremony attracts a very large number of spectators. The tradition of Well Dressing goes back to {Pagan times,}when the wells were decorated with flowers as a thanksgiving.
